overview:
Ardon Lukasiewicz is the Co-Founder of Ticketometer, an online service that allows artists to create shows that only happen if a minimum number of tickets are sold. He focuses on client management, business development and marketing.

Ardon is also a financial analyst at CityCenter in Las Vegas - the largest privately funded construction project in the history of the United States. Prior to CityCenter, he was a financial/business consultant for a solar energy company based in Nevada. While attending Bradley University, he worked on an apparel line start-up for a Las Vegas entrepreneur and for Insight Holdings, a Las Vegas-based commercial real estate firm. Ardon was highly involved in the Pi Kappa Alpha fraternity, typically holding over four positions and creating the school’s largest volunteer-based fundraiser (St. Baldrick’s Day).

Ardon graduated from Bradley University with a Bachelor of Science in Finance.
